title: Utqiagvik, Alaska
summary: Utqiaġvik (Inupiaq: Utqiaġvik; IPA: [utqe.ɑʁvik], English: /ˌʊtkiˈɑːvɪk/ UUT-kee-AH-vik[5]), known as Barrow (/ˈbæroʊ/) from 1901 to 2016,[upper-alpha 1] is the borough seat and largest city of the North Slope Borough in the U.S. state of Alaska.[6] Located north of the Arctic Circle,[7] it is one of the northernmost cities and towns in the world and the northernmost in the United States, with nearby Point Barrow the country's northernmost land.
